description: TikTok Chief Executive Officer Shou Chew told employees that the social media company and its parent, ByteDance Ltd., signed binding agreements to create a US joint venture majority-owned by American investors. Bloomberg's Michael Shepard breaks down what we know. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: TikTok's Plans for New US Joint Venture

author: Yuliya Fedorinova, Sakura Murakami
description: Japan will host leaders from five Central Asian nations, convening the first summit at the highest level as the resource-rich region draws growing interest from global powers.
title: Japan Eyes Bigger Role in Central Asia With First Leaders Summit

author: Fola Akinnibi, Sophie Alexander, Alicia A. Caldwell, Rachel Adams-Heard
description: Agency envisions up to two dozen warehouses, some of which could hold 5,000 people or more.
title: ICE Plans Detention Expansion With Deal to Design 'Mega Centers'

author: Jen Judson, Courtney McBride
description: For months, legal experts and members of Congress have questioned the legality of President Donald Trump’s military campaign against alleged narco-terrorists off Venezuela and Colombia. A new blockade on oil tankers compounded those concerns.
title: Tanker Blockade Spurs New Legal Questions on Venezuela Campaign

author: Edwina Otira
description: Efforts to shrink its beloved safety net face legislative gridlock. Bloomberg Originals explores what may force change and what could be lost.
title: Solving France’s Intractable Debt Problem

description: Faced with rising populism and legislative gridlock, efforts to shrink France’s famous social safety net have hit a wall. We explore what could be lost, the risks of delay and what may force change. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Can France Fix Its Debt Problem?

description: US lawmakers confirmed fintech billionaire and SpaceX astronaut Jared Isaacman to run NASA on Wednesday, ending a prolonged and whipsawing nomination process that had left the space agency without a permanent administrator for most of the year. He speaks with Bloomberg's Ed Ludlow about Trump's executive order reaffirming the Artemis program, NASA's relevancy and his ambitions to put a base on the moon.  (Source: Bloomberg)
title: NASA Chief Isaacman on Artemis Program, Plans for Moon Outpost

author: Katherine Doherty
description: The New York Stock Exchange and Nasdaq Inc. said they won’t alter their trading schedules on Dec. 24 and Dec. 26 after President Donald Trump’s executive order to close the federal government on those days.
title: NYSE, Nasdaq Say Stock-Market Hours Unchanged on Dec. 24 and 26

author: Mark Niquette
description: The government shutdown may have caused some quirks in the data
title: Trump Gets Good News on Inflation, With Some Important Caveats

author: Courtney McBride, Roxana Tiron
description: The chairman of the Senate Armed Services Committee said his panel has found “no evidence of war crimes” after examining US strikes on alleged drug trafficking vessels, potentially relieving congressional pressure on the Trump administration over the controversial military campaign.
title: Senate Panel Says ‘No Evidence of War Crimes’ in US Boat Strikes

author: Augusta Saraiva
description: Brazil’s congress expelled Jair Bolsonaro’s son Thursday less than a month after the former president began serving a 27-year sentence.
title: Brazilian Congress Expels Bolsonaro’s Son Who Spent Months Lobbying Washington

description: The Trump administration is turning to private firms to help launch cyber offensives, according to people familiar with the matter. The move would open an opaque cybersecurity process to private companies as the administration prepares to make aggressive cyber moves against foreign adversaries.  Bloomberg's Jamie Tarabay reports. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Trump Administration Turning to Private Firms in Cyber Offensive

author: Anthony Capaccio
description: The latest mammoth US arms sale to Taiwan signals that the Trump administration will look to maintain its strong defense ties with the island even as it boosts its trade and economic relationship with China.
title: US Balances Taiwan Backing and China Trade Push With Arms Sale

author: Martha Viotti Beck
description: Brazil’s Finance Minister, Fernando Haddad, said he will step down in February to help in President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva’s reelection campaign.
title: Haddad to Step Down as Brazilian Finance Minister in February

description: ConnectOne Bank Chairman & CEO Frank Sorrentino joined Carol Massar and Tim Stenovec on 'Bloomberg Businessweek Daily' to discuss the small business backdrop in New York amid the incoming Zohran Mamdani administration.  (Source: Bloomberg)
title: ConnectOne CEO on NY Business Landscape Amid Incoming Mamdani Administration

author: Jen Judson
description: The US Federal Aviation Administration has issued a notification to pilots to exercise extreme caution due to a “worsening security situation and heightened military activity” around Venezuela, as President Donald Trump ramps up pressure on Nicolas Maduro.
title: FAA Warns of Military Aircraft Flying Undetected in Caribbean

description: BNY Chief Investment Officer Jason Granet describes the state of the market environment in 2025 as 'non linear,' with expectations of more of the same coming in 2026. He joined Carol Massar and Tim Stenovec on 'Bloomberg Businessweek Daily' to discuss the six big questions for investors in 2026, including what’s next for central banks and who might be the long-term winners of AI. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: BNY's Jason Granet on Six Questions That May Shape 2026

author: Kate Sullivan
description: US President Donald Trump said Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu would “probably” meet with him in Florida as roadblocks remain in moving to the second phase of the Gaza ceasefire.
title: Trump Says Netanyahu to ‘Probably’ Visit Florida for Meeting

description: President Trump answers questions on the health care legislation, the search for the next Fed Chair and the announcement that the Kennedy Center will be renamed to the 'Trump-Kennedy' Center in the Oval Office. President Trump signed an executive order that reclassified marijuana as a schedule III drug, easing restrictions on use in medical situations. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Trump Signs Order to Ease Cannabis Restrictions: Q&A

description: Democrat Representative from Maryland Sarah Elfreth says that changing the name on the Kennedy Center to add Trump's would require an act of Congress and she would be a no vote.  Elfreth said that while she doesn't expect a floor vote on extending ACA subsidies before the House leaves for the holidays, she hopes that the fight for health care is something that brings back Americans' faith in the Democratic party.  (Source: Bloomberg)
title: White House Says Kennedy Center to be Renamed 'Trump-Kennedy Center'

description: President Donald Trump says he's interviewing “three or four” candidates for Federal Reserve chair and expected to have a decision pretty quickly on who he would nominate to replace Jerome Powell. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Trump Praises Waller and Bowman, Says Fed Pick Coming in Weeks

author: Alberto Nardelli, Augusta Saraiva, Donato Paolo Mancini
description: European Union leaders missed a self-imposed deadline to complete a free-trade agreement with a South American bloc of countries this week, according to people familiar with the discussions.
title: EU to Delay Mercosur Trade Deal Signing to January

description: On the early edition of Balance of Power, Bloomberg Washington Correspondent Joe Mathieu discusses President Donald Trump's address to the nation Wednesday night. On today's show, Republican Congressman Jodey Arrington of Texas, Groundwork Collaborative Managing Director Liz Pancotti, Democratic Congressman Sarah Elfreth of Maryland, Stonecourt Capital Partner Rick Davis and Harvard Kennedy School's Ash Center Visiting Democracy Fellow Jeanne Sheehan Zaino. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Trump Tries to Ease Price Anxiety | Balance of Power: Early Edition 12/18/2025

author: Courtney Subramanian
description: President Donald Trump said he was interviewing “three or four” candidates for Federal Reserve chair and expected to have a decision pretty quickly on who he would nominate to replace Jerome Powell.
title: Trump Praises Waller and Bowman, Says Fed Pick Coming in Weeks

description: Republican Representative Jodey Arrington, chair of the Budget Committee, said there's little chance of any deal emerging to extend existing Obamacare premium subsidies that can pass Congress (Source: Bloomberg)
title: TX Rep. Arrington Says ACA Subsidies 'Propping Up a Failed System'

description: President Donald Trump signs an executive order directing his administration to move cannabis into a less restrictive federal category. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Trump Signs Order Easing Federal Restrictions on Marijuana

description: Underlying US inflation rose in November at the slowest annual pace since early 2021, with the core consumer price index increasing 2.6% from a year ago. The report offers some hope that inflationary pressures are easing, with the core CPI rising just 0.2% over the two months ended in November, restrained by declines in costs of hotel stays, recreation and apparel. Bloomberg's Ed Harrison joined Carol Massar and Tim Stenovec on 'Bloomberg Businessweek Daily' to break it down. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: US Core CPI Eases to Four-Year Low in Shutdown-Impacted Report

description: In a wide-ranging interview with Bloomberg's Mishal Hussain taped in Washington on December 18, White House Senior Counselor for Trade and Manufacturing Peter Navarro addressed the photos of his White House colleagues taken for Vanity Fair's profile on Chief of Staff Susie Wiles. The full episode of The Mishal Hussain Show airs on January 9, wherever you get your podcasts. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Peter Navarro on Vanity Fair Profile of Susie Wiles

author: Charles Gorrivan
description: President Donald Trump on Thursday signed an executive order directing his administration to move cannabis into a less restrictive federal category, setting in motion a regulatory shift that could alter the legal and commercial landscape for the drug nationwide.
title: Trump Signs Order to Ease Cannabis Restrictions in Industry Win

author: Emily Birnbaum
description: A group of congressional Democrats has asked a government watchdog to probe whether Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick is violating ethics guidelines by promoting data center projects that could enrich his family.
title: Lutnick’s Data Center Ties Face Democratic Lawmaker Scrutiny

description: While Supreme Court justices get the glory (and the blame), district court judges have been standing up to the Trump administration more than any other part of the government, says Bloomberg Opinion columnist and Harvard Law professor Noah Feldman. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: The Real Heroes in the War on the Rule of Law

author: Molly Smith
description: After long-awaited government data showed underlying US inflation cooled to a four-year low in November, economists agreed on at least this much: something was off.
title: ‘Swiss Cheese’ CPI Report Raises Doubts About US Inflation Data

author: Catherine Lucey
description: The premier performing arts venue in Washington will be renamed the Trump-Kennedy Center, the White House announced Thursday.
title: Kennedy Center to Be Renamed to Honor Trump, White House Says

author: Ellen Milligan, Alex Wickham
description: Christian Turner will become Britain’s next ambassador to the US, putting an end to the three-month wait for a permanent successor to Peter Mandelson.
title: UK Appoints Turner as US Ambassador After Mandelson Exit

author: Jamie Tarabay
description: House Democrats released more photos Thursday from the estate of the late Jeffrey Epstein showing him with prominent public figures and items such as his passport.
title: House Democrats Release More Epstein Photos

author: Augusta Saraiva, Donato Paolo Mancini
description: Odds that the trade deal between the European Union and Mercosur will be signed in January appeared to improve slightly after a call between Brazil’s Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva and Italian Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni.
title: Hopes for January EU-Mercosur Deal Rise After Lula-Meloni Call

author: Courtney Subramanian
description: Two dozen top artificial intelligence companies have signed on to join the federal government’s “Genesis Mission,” an effort by the Trump administration to boost the use of the emerging technology for scientific discovery and energy projects.
title: Microsoft, Google Among 24 Firms Joining US AI ‘Genesis Mission’

author: Sonia Sirletti, Alessandra Migliaccio, Antonio Vanuzzo
description: Italy didn’t exert undue influence over the Banca Monte dei Paschi di Siena SpA takeover of smaller rival Mediobanca SpA, Finance Minister Giancarlo Giorgetti said.
title: Italy Didn’t Influence Paschi’s Bid on Mediobanca, Minister Says

author: Monique Vanek
description: The US warned South Africa of “severe consequences” over what it said was the detention of American officials providing humanitarian support to Afrikaners, the latest instance of animosity between the two nations.
title: US Rebukes South Africa Over Alleged Detention of Its Officials

author: Alex Wickham
description: Some local elections due to take place across England next year may be delayed in a move that could limit the losses faced by Prime Minister Keir Starmer’s governing Labour Party.
title: Some of Starmer’s Make-Or-Break Local Elections May Be Delayed

author: Max Rivera
description: The New York State Office of Cannabis Management voted Thursday to reopen a shuttered upstate medical marijuana production facility, paving the way for new ownership to revive a facility that was among the first of its kind in the state.
title: Closed Marijuana Factory to Get New Life in Upstate New York

author: Martin Z Braun
description: Democratic Mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani, facing a deficit of as much as $10 billion in the next fiscal year, named a veteran of three mayoral administrations as New York City’s budget director.
title: Mamdani Names NYC Budget Director as $10 Billion Deficit Looms

author: Gregory Korte, Courtney McBride
description: President Donald Trump’s promise to send 1.45 million US troops a “warrior dividend” worth $1,776 will be tax-free, Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth said Thursday — an unusual maneuver that was previewed in the “One Big Beautiful Bill” when it became law last summer.
title: Trump’s $1,776 ‘Warrior Dividend’ Will Be Tax-Free, Hegseth Says

author: Thomas Seal
description: Prime Minister Mark Carney said Canada probably won’t reach a near-term deal with the US to lower tariffs on sectors such as steel and aluminum, and negotiations are likely to be rolled into next year’s review of the US-Mexico-Canada Agreement.
title: Carney Says Sector Deals With US Now ‘Unlikely’ as USMCA Talks Loom

author: Volodymyr Verbianyi, Daryna Krasnolutska
description: Ukraine restructured its growth-linked debt into conventional bonds, ditching an instrument that would be “toxic” in a post-war recovery scenario, Finance Minister Serhiy Marchenko said.
title: Ukraine Ditches ‘Toxic’ Debt That Would Hurt Post-War Recovery

author: Gaspard Sebag
description: French Culture Minister Rachida Dati is at the center of a corruption investigation that triggered raids in Paris on Thursday over suspicions linked to her prior role as European lawmaker.
title: French Culture Minister Targeted by Raids in Corruption Probe

author: Jen Judson
description: Boeing Co. selected Anduril Industries to provide rocket motors for an interceptor to counter cruise missiles and drones in its bid for a US Army contract, a move that comes as the Trump administration seeks to broaden the base of weapons suppliers and accelerate production.
title: Boeing Taps Anduril in Bid For Army’s Cruise Missile Interceptor

author: Maria Elena Vizcaino, Nicolle Yapur
description: Holders of Venezuelan debt are starting to question whether the rally that pushed bonds to the highest in years has gone too far.
title: After 101% Rally, Venezuela Bondholders Fret Maduro Will Hold On

author: Laura Dhillon Kane
description: Prime Minister Mark Carney’s government signed a deal with Ontario to remove duplication in environmental assessments as Canada pushes to develop resources and build projects more quickly.
title: Canada and Ontario Ink Deal to Ban Regulatory Duplication on Major Projects

author: Kate Sullivan
description: President Donald Trump announced a slew of events to celebrate America’s 250th birthday next year, including a parade, athletic competition for high schoolers and fair on the National Mall.
title: Trump Plans ‘Patriot Games,’ National Fair for 250th Anniversary

author: Mark Schroers, Craig Stirling
description: Christine Lagarde said lawyers previously reckoned that a serving European Central Bank Executive Board member would be ineligible for the presidency, but she called for more study on the matter.
title: Lagarde Urges Look at ECB Board Rules as Schnabel Eyes Her Job

author: Felipe Saturnino, Josue Leonel
description: Brazilian traders are increasingly hedging against a drop in the real after former President Jair Bolsonaro backed his son in next year’s election, instead of supporting investors’ favorite Tarcisio de Freitas.
title: Brazil FX Hedges Rise as Bolsonaro Upends Election Optimism

description: European Central Bank President Christine Lagarde said the inflation outlook continues to be more uncertain than usual. “Inflation could turn out to be lower if the rise in US tariffs reduces demand for euro-area exports,” Lagarde explained during a news conference in Frankfurt after policymakers left interest rates unchanged for a fourth straight meeting. “By contrast, inflation could turn out to be higher if more fragmented global supply chains pushed up import prices, curtailed the supply of
title: ECB’s Lagarde Says Inflation Outlook Still Uncertain

author: Anthony Halpin
description: Russia’s central bank issued a new warning to the European Union, saying it may seek compensation in local courts from European lenders should the bloc proceed with using assets frozen in Europe to support Ukraine.
title: Russia Warns of Claims Against European Banks Over Frozen Assets

author: Rajesh Kumar Singh
description: India’s parliament passed a bill that will open up its nuclear industry to private firms and unlock investment opportunities worth $214 billion, after tight regulations stifled the sector for decades.
title: India Overhauls Nuclear Law to Allow Private Investment

author: Alberto Nardelli, Daryna Krasnolutska
description: The US and Ukraine’s European allies have put together a plan of security guarantees containing detailed, robust and serious measures to ensure that any peace deal with Russia holds, according to officials familiar with the proposals.
title: Ukraine Security Plan Offers Robust Protections, Officials Say

author: Alaric Nightingale
description: The UK government imposed sanctions on three smaller Russian oil producers, as a US-brokered peace deal between Moscow and Kyiv remains elusive.
title: UK Targets Three Smaller Russian Oil Producers in Latest Curbs

author: Marton Eder
description: A court in Russia ordered Raiffeisen Bank International AG’s unit in the country to pay €339 million ($397 million), another ruling forcing payments since the beginning of last year.
title: Russian Court Orders Raiffeisen to Pay €339 Million in Damages

author: Daniel Hornak
description: Slovakia’s top court blocked Prime Minister Robert Fico’s proposed laws tightening rules on nongovernmental organizations and loosening protections for whistleblowers, following criticism from the European Union.
title: Slovak Court Blocks Fico’s Crackdown on Whistleblower Protection

author: Scott Squires, Alex Vasquez
description: Probe has led to the arrest of a high-ranking naval officer, ouster of attorney general
title: Fuel-Smuggling Crackdown Threatens to Backfire on Mexico's Sheinbaum

author: Sanne Wass, Sara Sjolin
description: The European Union’s top court warned that Denmark’s so-called ghetto law aimed at cutting the proportion of immigrants in inner-city areas may amount to ethnic discrimination.
title: Danish ‘Ghetto’ Law Risks Being Ethnic Discrimination, Top EU Court Warns

author: Ben Bartenstein
description: The UK sanctioned oil trading tycoon Murtaza Lakhani, part of a new package targeting Russia over its war against Ukraine.
title: UK Sanctions Pakistani Tycoon Lakhani for Russian Energy Role

author: Kamil Kowalcze, Petra Sorge
description: Germany’s government kicked off a new investment vehicle intended to attract tens of billions of euros in private capital for energy infrastructure, raw materials, defense and startups.
title: Germany Launches Fund to Draw €100 Billion in Private Capital

author: Heesu Lee
description: South Korea’s Defense Ministry said it aims to conclude negotiations with the US within the next two years on securing an arrangement for the supply of nuclear fuel needed to power the nation’s planned nuclear-powered submarine.
title: South Korea Aims to Seal Nuclear-Sub Fuel Talks With US in 2 Years

author: Daniel Flatley
description: From leading US trade negotiations with China and charting a course for the world’s biggest bond market to calming investors spooked by President Donald Trump’s most aggressive economic announcements, it’s been a busy 2025 for Scott Bessent.
title: Bessent’s 2025 Saw Powell and Argentina Rescues, Deficit Angst

author: Brian Platt, Laura Dhillon Kane
description: Mark Carney took the stage at a holiday event last week in a jubilant mood. He had just scored a political victory, and he was eager to make some theater of it.
title: Carney’s Holiday Moment of Triumph Masks a Tenuous Grip on Power

author: Alan Crawford
description: The EU pulled back on an effective ban on combustion engines.
title: US, EU Hand China Advantage in Global EV Race

author: Gresa Kraja
description: The European Union said it will lift all sanctions on Kosovo by the end of January, freeing up more than €200 million ($234 million) in stalled aid and development projects.
title: EU Will Unlock Aid to Kosovo in Pre-Election Boost to Kurti

author: Lucy White
description: The UK government is facing a revolt from its own backbenchers over plans to curb trial by jury, in a further blow to Prime Minister Keir Starmer’s leadership.
title: UK’s Starmer Faces Rebellion Over Plans to Curb Jury Trials

author: Andrew Rosati
description: President Luiz Inacio de Lula da Silva is polling well ahead of potential challengers in next year’s election after Flavio Bolsonaro joined the race for Brazil’s top job.
title: Lula Is Far Ahead of Flavio Bolsonaro in 2026 Race, Poll Shows

author: Andrea Palasciano, Oliver Crook
description: The European Union’s top diplomat poured cold water on the American proposal to reestablish economic ties with Russia as part of ongoing discussions to end Moscow’s war against Ukraine.
title: EU’s Top Diplomat Says ‘Good Luck’ to US Effort to Bring Putin Into Fold

author: Taonga Mitimingi
description: Zambia’s president signed into law a constitutional amendment bill that overhauls the composition of parliament before the country holds general elections in August.
title: Zambian President Signs Constitutional Amendment Bill Into Law

author: Julian Lee
description: Oil tankers hauling Russian crude across the Black Sea are taking a roundabout route along the coastlines of Georgia and Turkey — a measure that might help them to reduce the risk of being targeted by Ukrainian sea drones.
title: Russian Oil Tankers Cleave to Turkish Coast to Cut Drone Risks

author: Patpicha Tanakasempipat
description: Thailand’s army has recast its deadly clash with Cambodia as a battle against cybercriminals, adding a new motive for bombing runs across the border that it says are aimed at rooting out scammers.
title: Thailand Says Cambodia Border Fight Is Also a War on Scammers

author: Ott Tammik
description: Three Russian border guards crossed into Estonian territory for around 20 minutes on Wednesday, the Baltic nation said, in the latest incident that has put the NATO member on guard about Moscow’s intentions.
title: Estonia Says Russian Border Guards Briefly Entered Its Territory

author: Tracy Alloway, Joe Weisenthal
description: All eyes are on the race for New York's 12th congressional district.
title: Meet the Politician the AI Industry Is Trying to Stop

author: Kamil Kowalcze, Greg Ritchie
description: Germany will increase federal debt sales by a fifth next year to a record €512 billion ($601 billion) to fund a spending splurge aimed at fixing its crumbling infrastructure and modernizing its armed forces.
title: Germany Boosts Debt Sales to Record in Spending Push

author: Tracy Alloway, Joe Weisenthal
title: Odd Lots: The Politician the AI Industry Wants to Stop (Podcast)

description:
Bloomberg Daybreak Europe is your essential morning viewing to stay ahead. 

On today's show, US President Trump said he’ll announce his Fed chair pick “soon.” He also touted plans to award payments to service members and roll out housing reforms to address economic anxieties during his prime-time address.

BP appointed Woodside’s Meg O’Neill as CEO, making her Big Oil’s first woman leader. She will replace Murray Auchincloss in April as the company works to recover from a botched renewable energy pivot.

The BOE is poised to cut rates by a quarter point to 3.75% today, responding to cooling inflation and economic struggles. The ECB is seen keeping borrowing costs at 2%, with analysts expecting the rate to stay there through 2027.

Today's guests: Camille de Courcel, Head of Developed Markets Rates Strategy and Europe Economics at BNP Paribas Markets 360 & Exein Founder and CEO Gianni Cuozzo. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Trump Prime-Time Address Insists Economy is Strong; First Female BP CEO | Daybreak Europe 12/18/2025

description: European Union Foreign Policy Chief Kaja Kallas discusses efforts to approve a massive loan to Ukraine backed by frozen Russian assets, a plan which Belgium is resisting. “Belgium is under a lot of pressure from Russia, from a lot of Europeans, also from from United States,” Kallas tells Bloomberg’s Oliver Crook in Brussels. “If we have the European proposal, then Belgium is just abiding the law. So anybody who has anything to say against can go to court against the European Union, which means t
title: Kallas Says EU Mustn’t Fail on Ukraine Loan Agreement

author: Hallie Gu, Isis Almeida, Michael Hirtzer
description: China has secured at least 7 million tons of US soybeans after heavy buying in the past two weeks, passing the halfway mark toward meeting its 12-million ton purchase agreement with the Trump administration, according to people familiar with the deals.
title: China Has Bought More Than Half the Soybeans It Promised From US

author: Sanne Wass, Andrea Palasciano, Michael Nienaber, Jorge Valero
description: Calls are growing for the European Union to approve a massive loan to Ukraine backed by frozen Russian assets without the support of Belgium, where nearly all the assets are located.
title: Belgium Faces Pressure to Back Ukraine Loan or Be Outvoted

description: Turkey is seeking to return S-400 air defense systems it bought from Russia nearly a decade ago, a move that would end a controversial deal that roiled its relationship with the US and other NATO members. Such a move would also potentially allow Ankara to buy the American F-35 stealth fighters it has long sought. Bloomberg’s Onur Ant reports.
title: Turkey Wants to Return Russian S-400 Air Defense Systems

author: Alaric Nightingale
description: An oil tanker caught fire after an overnight drone attack on Russia’s southern city of Rostov, as Ukraine expands the scope of strikes on energy assets.
title: Oil Tanker Catches Fire After Drone Strike in Russia’s Rostov

author: Ram Anand
description: Former Malaysian Prime Minister Najib Razak heads into a pivotal week in court, with two rulings that could reopen his path back to power.
title: Two Pivotal Court Rulings Could Pave Najib’s Political Comeback After 1MDB

author: Sergio Mendoza
description: Bolivian President Rodrigo Paz declared an economic emergency late Wednesday night and issued an array of dramatic steps, including scrapping fuel subsidies and loosing the country’s exchange rate regime.
title: Bolivia Declares Economic Emergency, Scraps Fuel Subsidies

author: Jorge Valero, Ania Nussbaum
description: European Union leaders will try to overcome staunch resistance to both a funding plan for Ukraine and a massive trade deal with South America during a summit in Brussels starting Thursday — insisting that the bloc’s reputation is on the line.
title: EU Leaders Fight Over Ukraine Aid and Trade Deal: What to Watch

author: Yian Lee
description: The US has approved a package of major arms sales to Taiwan worth up to $11 billion, a move that will most likely draw a sharp response from Beijing.
title: US Approves $11 Billion Arms Sale to Taiwan, Risking China Anger

author: Yoshiaki Nohara
description: A US-Japan consultation panel held its first meeting to consider initial projects for a $550 billion investment pledge that is a pillar of the two countries’ trade deal.
title: US, Japan Panel Convene to Mull Projects for $550 Billion Fund

author: Jennifer A Dlouhy
description: President Donald Trump announced plans to award 1.45 million service members $1,776 payments as he sought to reassure Americans concerned about his stewardship of the US economy.
title: Trump Announces Military ‘Warrior Dividend’ Amid Inflation Woes

author: Colum Murphy
description: China’s top diplomat expressed support for Venezuela on Wednesday, criticizing one-sided coercion hours after President Donald Trump ordered a blockade of oil tankers to ratchet up pressure on the South American nation.
title: China Backs Venezuela After Trump Orders Oil Tanker Blockade

author: Josh Xiao
description: China is dispatching a diplomat to Cambodia and Thailand as a new bout of violence between the two Southeast Asian nations threatens to derail a ceasefire brokered by President Donald Trump.
title: China Seeks to Mediate Thai-Cambodia Clash Trump Says He Ended

description: "Balance of Power: Late Edition" focuses on the intersection of politics and global business. On today's show, Republican Representative of New York, Mike Lawler and Democratic Senator of Nevada, Catherine Cortez Masto, discuss Congress' Vote on a Republican-backed healthcare bill and the discharge petition that is supported by moderate GOP lawmakers, and Roxanne Vigil, a Council of Foreign Affairs International Relations Fellow, talks about President Donald Trump's order to blockade oil tankers in Venezuela and the impact it can have on the country.  (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Moderate Republicans Defy Speaker Johnson on Health Care | Balance of Power: 12/17/2025

description: Roxanna Vigil, Council on Foreign Relations International Affairs Fellow, talks about President Donald Trump's order to blockade sanctioned oil tankers in Venezuela, and the ramifications it could have on the country's economy, and discusses Trump's claims that Venezuela 'illegally took our oil.' She speaks with Joe Mathieu and Bloomberg's Becca Wasser on 'Balance of Power.' (Source: Bloomberg)
title: CFR Fellow Vigil Discusses Venezuela Blockade

author: Daniel Carvalho
description: Brazil’s Senate approved legislation to reduce the sentence former leader Jair Bolsonaro must serve for plotting a coup after his narrow 2022 election loss, setting up a potential clash between Congress, President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva and the country’s Supreme Court.
title: Brazil Senate Approves Bill to Reduce Bolsonaro Jail Sentence
